Description: Ostracon of red pottery, inscribed with parts of 3 lines of Demotic text in black ink on the original exterior side, and parts of 4 lines on the other. The text contains references to a Year 5 and a Year 6, with the same cartouche. Part missing from the bottom edge. The exterior surface is red-slipped.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: University of Colorado Museum
Curator's comments: Lister, F., Ceramic Studies of the Historic Periods in Ancient Nubia. University of Utah Anthropological Papers, no. 86. Salt Lake City, 1967, pp. 69, 72-3, fig. 26d. See also William Y Adams, The West Bank Survey from Faras to Gemai. Sudan Archaeological Research Society Publication Number 13. BAR International Series 1335 (2005).
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (395031) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/395031)
Acquisition name: Donated by: University of Colorado Museum
